intro: Decaspermum hainanense, commonly known as the Hainan decaspermum, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically the Hainan Island. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Decaspermum hainanense is primarily of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
